intro: Pseudoschoenus inanis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as marshes and wetlands. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikes. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
